page.title: 05Highgate Common
page.content: On the common there are many interesting things. When we went we saw lots of wild flowers, bluebells, foxgloves, purple and white heather. There are brambles where the blackberries will grow. We saw a large toad. We saw butterflies and moths, birds and ladybirds. We saw a vole's hole and a fox's hole. There are lots of trees, mostly silver birch and oak. The common has picnic tables and sometimes there is an icecream man. He is usually there on Sundays. Some people collect collect leaves for their hobby. Other people take photographs. Some people climb trees. It is a nice big area. You can run about and play tick or have a picnic on the grass. There are car parks and public toilets. Some people take their dogs to the common because there is plenty of space for them to run about.
